summary.title: Lab 2 - University Website threat modeling
summary.description: The university website serves various user groups: students, faculty, staff, alumni, and prospective students. It provides access to course registration, grades, financial aid information, research publications, university news, and online communities. The website stores sensitive data like student records, financial information, and research data.

threats.title: Identity Impersonation
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate user by sending requests with forged credentials.
threats.mitigation: Use secure authentication mechanisms (e.g., OAuth, JWT) and validate user input to prevent spoofing.

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify data sent between the client and the server, leading to unauthorized data changes.
threats.mitigation: Use HTTPS to encrypt data in transit and validate all input on the server side.

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description: A user could deny performing certain actions on the server, such as submitting a form or updating data.
threats.mitigation: Implement logging and auditing mechanisms to track user actions and prevent repudiation.

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive information such as student's data transmitted between the client and the server could be intercepted and disclosed.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption (e.g., TLS/SSL) for data in transit and ensure sensitive information is not exposed in error messages.

threats.title: Denial of Service
threats.description: An attacker could overload the servlet with a large number of requests, causing it to become unresponsive.
threats.mitigation: Implement CAPTCHA to mitigate the impact of DoS attacks.

threats.title: Elevation of privilege
threats.description: An attacker could exploit vulnerabilities in the servlet to gain unauthorized access to privileged operations or data.
threats.mitigation: Implement least privilege access controls and regularly update and patch the servlet to prevent privilege escalation.

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description:
An attacker could potentially modify the
contents of web pages to inject
malicious code or deceive users
threats.mitigation: Use secure coding practices, input validation, and content security policies to prevent tampering.

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify data sent during the login process to gain unauthorized access or to perform other malicious actions.
threats.mitigation: Use secure encryption (e.g., HTTPS) to protect data in transit and validate all input on the server side.

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description: A user could deny having logged in or performed certain actions, leading to potential disputes or security issues.
threats.mitigation: Implement logging and auditing mechanisms to track user actions and prevent repudiation.

threats.title: Info disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive information, such as usernames or passwords, could be exposed to unauthorized users during the login process.
threats.mitigation: Store passwords in form of hashes and educate users about password security best practices.

threats.title: Elevation of privilege
threats.description: An attacker could exploit vulnerabilities in the login process to gain unauthorized access to privileged accounts or systems.
threats.mitigation: Implement least privilege access controls.

threats.title: T
threats.description: An attacker could modify or manipulate data stored in the database, leading to data corruption or unauthorized changes.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption to protect data integrity, implement input validation to prevent SQL injection attacks, and use access controls to restrict who can modify data.

threats.title: R
threats.description: A user or application could deny having performed certain actions on the database.
threats.mitigation: Implement logging and auditing mechanisms to record all database transactions.

threats.title: DoS
threats.description: An attacker could launch a DoS attack against the database, rendering it unavailable to legitimate users.
threats.mitigation: Implement load balancing.

threats.title: E
threats.description: An attacker could exploit vulnerabilities in the database to gain unauthorized access or privileges to the content of the tables.
threats.mitigation: Implement proper access controls to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data.

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could modify course registration data to change course selections, enrollments, or schedules.
threats.mitigation: Implement data validation checks to ensure that only valid and authorized changes are accepted.

threats.title: ID
threats.description: Sensitive information about course selections, schedules, or student preferences could be disclosed to unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption and access controls to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access.

threats.title: EoP
threats.description: An attacker could exploit vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access to administrative functions or to manipulate course registration data.
threats.mitigation: Implement least privilege access controls.

threats.title: R
threats.description: A student registers for a course or makes changes to their course schedule but later denies having done.
threats.mitigation: Implement logging and auditing mechanisms that record all actions taken by students during the course registration process.

threats.title: I
threats.description: Sensitive information stored in data files could be exposed to unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption to protect the confidentiality of data files, and implement access controls to restrict who can access sensitive information.

threats.title: T
threats.description: An attacker could modify the contents of a data file to alter data.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data files, and implement access controls to prevent unauthorized modifications.

threats.title: S
threats.description: An attacker could spoof their identity to the authorization provider, pretending to be a legitimate user or system component.
threats.mitigation: Implement two-factor authentication to ensure no unauthorized user.

threats.title: T
threats.description: An attacker could tamper with the data managed by the authorization provider, such as access control policies or permissions.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption and digital signatures to protect the integrity of data stored and processed by the authorization provider.

threats.title: ID
threats.description: Sensitive information managed by the authorization provider, such as access control policies or user permissions, could be exposed to unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption and access controls to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access.

threats.title: ID
threats.description: Sensitive information managed by the authorization provider, such as access control policies or user permissions, could be exposed to unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption and access controls to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access.

threats.title: T
threats.description: An attacker could tamper with the data of the groups and users.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption.

threats.title: S
threats.description: Un attaquant pourrait potentiellement usurper l'identit d'un tudiant ou d'un membre du corps professoral pour accder  des notes auxquelles il n'a pas droit
threats.mitigation: Utilisation d'une authentification forte, telle que l'authentification  deux facteurs, pour s'assurer que seuls les utilisateurs lgitimes peuvent accder aux notes

threats.title: T
threats.description: Un attaquant pourrait intercepter les communications entre le Grade Checking Process et la base de donnes de l'universit pour modifier les notes des tudiants
threats.mitigation: Utilisation de mcanismes de scurit comme le chiffrement des donnes en transit et l'implmentation de contrles d'intgrit pour s'assurer que les donnes ne sont pas altres pendant le transfert ou le stockage

threats.title: R
threats.description: Un tudiant ou un membre du corps professoral pourrait nier avoir consult ou modifi des notes, ce qui compliquerait la traabilit des actions
threats.mitigation: La mise en place d'un systme de journalisation robuste qui enregistre toutes les interactions avec les notes, y compris les accs et les modifications, peut aider  fournir des preuves d'activit

threats.title: ID
threats.description: Des informations sensibles, telles que les notes d'tudiants, pourraient tre divulgues  des utilisateurs non autoriss, compromettant ainsi la confidentialit des donnes
threats.mitigation: Mise en place de contrles d'accs stricts pour garantir que seuls les utilisateurs autoriss peuvent accder aux notes des tudiants + chiffrement des donnes sensibles lorsqu'elles sont stockes et en transfert peut aider  prvenir les fuites d'informations en cas d'accs non autoris

threats.title: S
threats.description: Un attaquant pourrait usurper l'identit d'un utilisateur lgitime pour accder aux fonctionnalits du systme universitaire
threats.mitigation: Utilisation d'une authentification forte pour s'assurer que seuls les utilisateurs lgitimes peuvent accder au systme

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Un attaquant pourrait modifier les donnes transitant entre les utilisateurs et le systme universitairr
threats.mitigation: Utilisation de protocoles de communication scuriss pour garantir l'intgrit des donnes en cours de transfert

threats.title: DOS
threats.description: un attaquant pourrait tenter de submerger le systme universitaire avec un grand nombre de requtes pour le rendre indisponible
threats.mitigation: Utilisation de techniques de protection contre les attaques de dni de service, telles que la limitation du nombre de requtes par utilisateur et la mise en place de listes blanches d'adresses IP autorises

threats.title: T
threats.description: Un attaquant pourrait modifier les nouvelles stockes dans le "University News Store" pour diffuser de fausses informations.
threats.mitigation: Utilisation de contrles d'intgrit pour dtecter toute altration non autorise des donnes stockes dans le "University News Store"

threats.title: ID
threats.description: Des nouvelles sensibles ou confidentielles pourraient tre divulgues  des utilisateurs non autoriss
threats.mitigation: Appliquer des contrles d'accs stricts pour limiter l'accs aux nouvelles sensibles uniquement aux utilisateurs autoriss

threats.title: R
threats.description: Un utilisateur malveillant pourrait nier avoir effectu certaines actions dans le university news store
threats.mitigation: Mise en place d'une journalisation adquate de toutes les actions effectues pour permettre la traabilit des activits
